fields.name: Malleus Maleficarum
fields.description: A nearby land has outlawed magic. You have heard rumors about religious fanatics there accusing people of witchcraft. Join a young adventurer friend on a quest to save her grandmother from persecution.
fields.intro_text:
While lounging around the Main Hall between adventures, you got to know a young novice adventurer named Maya. She comes from the Duchy of Virrat, a nearby agricultural region which has experienced a recent trend of religious fervor. One day, she finds you in the tavern and pulls you aside.

"Have you heard the news from Virrat? The Duke has issued a decree outlawing all magic in the entire land. My grandmother, Ainha, is a healer in the capital city. She sent me a letter a week ago, saying she was worried about the bands of religious fanatics that were starting to roam the town. They're arresting all the magic users they can find, accusing them of witchcraft. She was talking about leaving town, but I haven't heard from her since then."

Maya continues, "I'm worried something has happened to her. I'm leaving in the morning to go there to try to find her, and I could use a spare sword for defense. Will you join me?"

You have really taken a liking to your young adventurer pal, and she certainly doesn't have the training to take on a band of fanatics by herself. You quickly agree and pack your bags to head out of town.

---

As you reach the borders of Virrat, Maya pulls out a map of the area:

![Map of the Duchy of Virrat, showing Virrat City, a walled city, in the east and a small town of Lieto in the northwest. A road connects them, passing by a ruined castle and a set of standing stones.](/static/adventures/malleus-maleficarum/virrat-map.jpg)

It takes three days to reach Virrat City. As you ride, you see more and more armed men wearing blue religious tabards over their armor. They act more like an army than a band of fanatics. You start to see signs of struggle and burned houses in some of the farming and fishing villages along the Tovesi River. It only gets worse as you approach the capital.

At the gates of the city, freshly painted signs have been posted warning, "No mages allowed, by order of the Cobalt Front. Magic use is punishable by death!"

---

You arrive in the city square to find a crowd of townsfolk and a large band of white-cloaked fighters. Four women and one man are being led to the stocks by the inquisitors. As one young woman is brought forward, she struggles free of her bonds and shouts some arcane words. You sense the tingle of magic growing in the air. Before the spell completes, an inquisitor lands a swift kick to her ribs. Gasping for breath, she is forced into the stocks. As the latch closes, the magic dissipates from the air as if a switch has been thrown. The crowd of onlookers cheers riotously.

You grab Maya's arm and the two of you slink away to the south end of the square. "I don't like the looks of this place," you say. "Let's be very careful."

---

Author's note: This adventure makes use of the TALK command. You can gain information from some people by talking to them, e.g., "TALK TO MAYA". You'll want to talk to Maya often; what she says will change after you visit certain places and find certain items.

fields.name: The south end of the grand plaza
fields.description: You are at the southern end of the grand plaza of Virrat City. The main highway leads east and west. To the north is the rest of the plaza, and to the south is a stone bridge spanning the Tovesi River.

fields.name: The north end of the grand plaza
fields.description: You are in the central square of Virrat City. There are crowds of civilians around. The Duke's Palace, an imposing white stone building, lies to the north. To the west is a towering cathedral made of the same white stone. You can also move south toward the south end of the plaza.

fields.name: The palace courtyard
fields.description: You are in the courtyard of the Duke's Palace. White stone walls surround you to the east and west. Tall double doors lie to the north, and to the south is the grand plaza.

fields.name: The Duke's Palace
fields.description: You are in the grand entry hall of the palace. The walls are covered in tapestries depicting pious religious acts and great scenes of battle. Doors lead further into the palace but they are barred shut. The only exit is through the double doors to the south.

fields.name: The cathedral
fields.description: The Virrat Cathedral is an impressive building made of white stone. A large altar dominates the west end of the room. Light shines down through vibrant stained-glass windows depicting ancient religious figures walking among verdant farm fields. You notice that the church is entirely devoid of Cobalt Front symbols. A small door behind the altar leads to the priests' chambers.

fields.name: The sacristy
fields.description: You are in the priests' chambers in the back of the cathedral. The room is plain and has a low ceiling. There are writing desks and bookshelves full of holy books on the walls. The only exit is to the east.

fields.name: On the bridge
fields.description: The wide, arched stone bridge rises above the muddy waters of the Tovesi River. To the north is the grand plaza. To the south is a wide, tree-lined street.

fields.name: Main Street, near the bridge
fields.description: You are at the north end of Main Street. To the north is the bridge over the river. The street extends into the distance to the south. To the east is a city park. To the west is a bustling shop with a battle axe on the sign over the door.

fields.name: The ruins of the magic shop
fields.description: You are inside a ruined building. By the looks of the smashed objects lying around, this used to be a magic shop. The Cobalt Front must have been here, and they did a thorough job of wrecking the place. The only exit is west.

fields.name: In the park
fields.description: You are in a pleasant park along the banks of the river. There are trees, a walking path, and park benches. The river is to the north, and the city wall is to the east. Paths lead out to the streets to the west and south.

fields.name: A four-way intersection
fields.description: You are at an intersection in the southern part of town. Main Street runs north and south, and a smaller residential street runs east and west.

fields.name: Harvest Street
fields.description: You are on an east-west residential street. The houses here are all locked, so you may only go east or west.

fields.name: The west end of Harvest Street
fields.description: The east-west street ends here, with the city wall blocking the way west. There are houses to the north and south. The houses on the north are shut tight, but one of the ones to the south has a light in the window. The street continues to the east.

fields.name: Talia's house
fields.description: This is a small house with simple furnishings. A cozy fire crackles in the fireplace. The only exit is to the north.

fields.name: Harvest Street, near the park
fields.description: You are on an east-west street running through the residential part of town. The city park is to the north. To the south is a row of low brick houses, built close together with no passages between them.

fields.name: The east end of Harvest Street
fields.description: You are in a residential area at the east end of the street. East is the city wall. North and south are houses that are locked up. The only exit is west.

fields.name: The south gate
fields.description: You are at the gate at the south end of Virrat City. Main Street stretches away to the north. To the south is the highway leading back to Eamon Towne.

fields.name: Water Street, near the tavern
fields.description: You are on the main road east of the city square. To the north is a stone wall. To the south is a tavern. The road continues to the east and west.

fields.name: Blue Heron Tavern
fields.description: This is a clean, well-lit tavern on the banks of the Tovesi River. The common room and the back lawn are full of patrons. A set of large double doors leads to the street to the north.

fields.name: Water Street, outside the prison
fields.description: You are on the main road east of the city square. To the north is the city prison. A lot of recent construction seems to have been happening in this area. The road continues to the east and west. To the south is the river, with no way across.

fields.name: The prison entrance
fields.description: The prison is a blocky stone building. The entrance is a spartan room with a few desks. The exit to the street is south, and the main wing of the prison is to the north.

fields.name: In the prison
fields.description: You are in the main hallway of the Virrat City prison. The double doors lead south to the entrance. Smaller doors lead east and west, and there is a stairway going down to the dungeons.

fields.name: In the prison office
fields.description: The prison warden's office is spartan, with just a few chairs and a desk with some papers on it. The exit is through a door to the east.

fields.name: A storage room
fields.description: You are in the prison storeroom. The walls are lined with metal cages and lockers.

fields.name: The dungeons
fields.description: You are at the entrance to the prison dungeons. It is dark down here, illuminated only by the meager light coming in through the small windows near the ceiling. A tunnel leads south and there are cell doors to the east and west. A stairway leads up.

fields.name: A west cell
fields.description: You are in a small cell on the west side of the dungeon. The only exit is a cell door to the east. Light comes from a small window near the ceiling.

fields.name: An east cell
fields.description: You are in a small cell on the east side of the dungeon. The only exit is a cell door to the west. Light comes from a small window near the ceiling.

fields.name: The dungeons
fields.description: You are at the south end of the dungeons. There are cell doors to the east and west, and a tunnel leading north. It is dark and cold down here.

fields.name: A west cell
fields.description: You are in a small cell on the west side of the dungeon. The only exit is a cell door to the east. Light comes from a small window near the ceiling.

fields.name: An east cell
fields.description: You are in a small cell on the east side of the dungeon. The only exit is a cell door to the west. Light comes from a small window near the ceiling.

fields.name: Water Street, near the east gate
fields.description: You are on a major east-west road, near the east gate of Virrat City. The road continues to the east and west. To the south is a large inn with a majestic heron on the sign. To the north is a stone wall.

fields.name: The Blue Heron Inn
fields.description: You are in the front office of a large inn. The doors to the rooms are all locked, so you may only exit to the street to the north.

fields.name: The east gate
fields.description: You are at the east gate in the city wall. The gates are open. Water Street leads west, and the East Road leads east out of town. To the north is an alley which leads between the wall and the prison.

fields.name: The East Road
fields.description: You are on the East Road. To the west is the gate of Virrat City. To the east is the road out of Virrat, where you may return to the Main Hall. A small house to the south has been badly damaged by a fire.

fields.name: Ainha's house
fields.description: You are standing in the ruins of the healer Ainha's house. A fire has gutted the building and there is nothing left of value. The ruined door leads north.

fields.name: A north-south alley
fields.description: You are in a north-south alley between the city wall and the stone wall of the prison. To the west, at street level, are the barred windows of the prison cells in the dungeon.

fields.name: A north-south alley
fields.description: You are in a north-south alley between the city wall and the stone wall of the prison. There are more cell windows along the west side of the street.

fields.name: The north end of an alley
fields.description: The alley ends here, with city walls to the north and east. The alley continues south, and there is a construction site to the west where masons are adding a new wing to the prison.

fields.name: A contruction site
fields.description: The prison is being expanded here. The masonry walls are mostly complete, though only half of the roof rafters have been installed. The city wall blocks passage to the north, and the palace wall blocks passage to the west. An alley is to the east.

fields.name: Water Street, outside the blacksmith shop
fields.description: You are on the main road just west of the plaza. The road continues east and west. A blacksmith shop is to the south. Passage north is blocked by the wall of the cathedral.

fields.name: The blacksmith shop
fields.description: You are in a blacksmith shop that lies between Water Street and the Tovesi River. Among the usual metalworking tools, you see a large number of horseshoes and sword blanks. The door to the north is the only exit.

fields.name: Water Street, near the west gate
fields.description: You are on the main road, near the west city gate. The road continues east and west. To the south is the door to the stables.

fields.name: The Stables
fields.description: You are in a large building used as the stables for riders using the main highway to the west. Most of the stalls are occupied by majestic Virrat horses and a number of smaller horses of different breeds. The room smells of hay and manure. A sliding door to the north leads to the street.

fields.name: The west gate
fields.description: The stone walls of Virrat City rise above you. The gates are open. To the west, a wide dirt highway leads out into farm country. To the east, a cobblestone street leads toward the center of town.

fields.name: An east-west highway near the standing stones
fields.description: The main highway leads west from Virrat City into the farm country. Fields of wheat, barley, and potatoes are interspersed with horse and cattle pastures. The river is to the south, and to the north is a small hillock with some standing stones on it.

fields.name: Among the standing stones
fields.description: You are in a verdant green clearing on a hillside. There is a circle of standing stones here, most of which have been knocked over. Trails lead south and west back to the main road.

fields.name: A T-intersection of roads
fields.description: The highway comes to an intersection here, at a bend in the river. The main road goes north and east. To the south is a side road leading across a bridge. The river bends northward here, blocking passage to the west.

fields.name: On an old bridge
fields.description: You are on an old stone bridge spanning the slow, muddy Tovesi River. To the north is the main highway. To the south is a weed-strewn road leading up a hill. At the top of the hill is the ruins of a castle, which seems to have been partially overgrown by vines.

fields.name: Outside the castle
fields.description: You are outside the ruined castle. The main gates have been destroyed, leaving the entrance wide open. The stone walls are badly damaged and covered by lush, tangled vines. The air is fetid and smells of rot and mold, with a trace of wood smoke. To the north, the road leads back down to the river. To the south is the castle courtyard.

fields.name: The entrance to the ruined castle
fields.description: You are at the entrance of the old castle. The walls and ceiling are crumbling from long years of disuse, though some of the damage looks recent. Vines cover most of the walls. A broken archway to the south leads into a large courtyard, and to the north is the road.

fields.name: Castle courtyard
fields.description: The main courtyard of the castle is full of rubble and broken beams. Vines cover everything, especially in the southwest corner. All the doorways are caved in or blocked with rubble, except the one in the west wall, which leads deeper into the vegetation. The castle entrance lies to the north, should you wish to leave before the vines devour you.

fields.name: A ruined stable
fields.description: You are in the ruins of what once might have been a stable. Plants grow everywhere, and vines cover the walls. They have penetrated the ceiling, leaving holes open to the sky. The castle courtyard is through a door to the east. There is a hole in the south wall, and the vegetation looks especially thick in that direction.

fields.name: In the jungle
fields.description: The vines are very thick here, barely allowing you to squeeze past. Through a hole in the castle wall, you see that the plants have sent roots down into what is left of the castle moat. With the water supply, they have grown to huge sizes. A narrow passage extends north and there is a hole in the wall to the south.

fields.name: The castle tower
fields.description: You are atop the tower of the castle, overlooking the farm fields of Virrat. Plants are everywhere, choking the view so you can barely see the sky. The only escape from the dense vegetation is a curving stairway leading down.

fields.name: A north-south highway near the standing stones
fields.description: The highway travels north-south here, still following the banks of the river. To the west is the river, and to the east is a small hill with some standing stones on it.

fields.name: A south-west bend in the highway
fields.description: The river bends from the west toward the south here, and the highway follows it. To the north and east lies the vast, rich farmland of Virrat.

fields.name: An east-west highway
fields.description: The highway runs east and west here. To the north is farmland, and to the south is the river. To the west, you see the walls of a small town.

fields.name: The east entrance to Lieto
fields.description: You are outside a small farming village. The highway leads east from here toward Virrat City. To the west is a rutted dirt street leading into the center of town.

fields.name: Market Street
fields.description: You are on the main street in the town of Lieto. The buildings are small and mostly wooden, and the road is well-rutted dirt. The road continues east and west. To the north is a small shop. To the south is a bustling farmers' market.

fields.name: The farm goods shop
fields.description: You are in a small shop selling farming implements, tools, and other assorted wares, none of which are of interest to an adventurer such as yourself. The door to the street is to the south.

fields.name: Market Street
fields.description: You are on the main street in the west site of Lieto. To the west is the town gate. To the east, the street continues. To the south is the farmers' market, and to the north is a nondescript building with Cobalt Front banners hanging from the eaves.

fields.name: The garrison
fields.description: This large building looks like it might once have served as a town hall or meeting place. It has been turned into a garrison for Cobalt Front soldiers. Bunks line the back walls, and desks and tables have been set up near the front.

fields.name: The west gate of Lieto
fields.description: You are at the west gate of the town of Lieto. As with everywhere else, there is a sign warning that magic users will be executed. A street leads east into the center of town. To the west is the road out of Virrat, which you may use to return to the Main Hall.

fields.name: The Lieto market
fields.description: You are in the farmers' market of Lieto. The stalls are full of produce and the place bustles with activity. A few Cobalt Front soldiers are nearby, as they are everywhere here, but the market seems to be mostly full of civilians. The market continues to the east, and the main street lies to the north.

fields.name: The Lieto market
fields.description: You are at the east end of the farmers' market. The stalls here are full of leather goods, dried meat, and cheese. The main street is north and the market continues to the west. Next to one of the leather-workers' stalls is a narrow alley leading south into a residential area. There are fewer soldiers here and no one would see you if you slipped into the alley.

fields.name: An alley
fields.description: You are in a narrow alley south of the farmers' market. There is no one around. To the east and west are the sides of houses. To the south, you see a nondescript house.

fields.name: The safe house
fields.description: You are in the basement of a small house. The curtains are drawn and the only light comes from a few flickering candles. A stairway leads up to the street, and a door to the south leads into a dark room.

fields.name: A bedroom
fields.description: You are in a small dark bedroom with the only exit being a doorway to the north.

fields.name: The recruiting office
fields.description: You are in the front room of a large building. The walls are covered with the banners and slogans of the Cobalt Front. Doors to the street are west and south. All other entrances are guarded by soldiers.

fields.name: The weapons shop
fields.description: You are in a large shop full of all kinds of weapons and armor. Especially popular are pikes and battle axes. You notice a complete lack of magical items. The door to the street is to the east.

fields.name: The south end of Main Street
fields.description:
You are at the south end of Main Street. The city gate is to the south, and the street stretches far in the distance to the north.

To the east, you see a derelict building with the windows smashed in and the door hanging askew from its hinges. The words "EVILDOERS REPENT" are painted on the wall in red paint.

fields.name: An east-west highway
fields.description: The main highway leads west from Virrat City into the farm country. Fields of wheat and potatoes are interspersed with cattle pastures. The river is to the south, and to the north are farm fields.

fields.name: A north-south highway near a campsite
fields.description:
The highway here runs north and south, following the river, which flows deep and wide through a small woods to the west. To the east is farmland.

A pair of tents and a campfire are set up next to the river here. You spot something bulky hidden under a tent flap.

fields.name: sloshing though the moat
fields.description: The castle once had a moat around it, and this is what's left of it. The vegetation is extra thick here, where the roots of the plants have grown down into the water. The air is fetid. You feel like you're lost in the swamp and you can't wait to leave this vile place. You can push through the wall of plants to the north or east. You may be able to go south or west as well, but it's hard to make out details.

fields.name: outside the south wall of the castle
fields.description: You are south of the castle, looking up at the vine-covered stone wall of the keep. The ground is drier here, but not much. The stones have crumbled, leaving ragged holes in the wall to the north and east, nearly grown over. To the west is a soggy path through the moat. South of you is an impenetrable wall of vegetation.

fields.name: the castle keep
fields.description: You are in the castle keep. The room is lit only by the light coming through a hole in the south wall. In the dim light, the foliage is thinner, but not entirely gone. There once was a doorway in the north wall, but it has collapsed, blocking the path back to the courtyard. A stone stairway, now covered in thick vegetation, leads up. The only other exit is through the hole to the south.

fields.name: A ruined bedroom
fields.description: You are in a small room just off the castle keep. From the ruined furniture about, it looks like it once was a bedroom. There is some trash strewn about, as if something was living here before the jungle consumed the castle. But now, everything is covered in plants which have grown in through the windows. The plants block every exit except through a rough hole in the western wall.

fields.name: long bow
fields.description: You see Maya's finely-crafted long bow. It is almost brand-new, with barely a scratch on it.

fields.name: prisoners
fields.description: You see several people bound in stocks in the middle of the square.

fields.name: wand of defoliation
fields.description: You see a polished wooden stick about the length of your forearm. It doesn't give off much of an aura of magic. One end is slightly charred but it otherwise appears intact.

fields.name: magic-proof bag
fields.description: You see a woolen bag with bluish metallic threads woven into the fabric. It is designed to shield magic auras from anything placed inside.

fields.name: Orb of Aquita
fields.description: You see a shiny orb that looks like it's made of crystal. From within glows a scintillating green light, almost too bright to look at. This must be the Orb of Aquita!

fields.name: ring of protection
fields.description: You see a golden ring with the symbol of a shield carved into the band.

fields.name: desk
fields.description: The prison warden's desk sits along the west wall of the office. One drawer is locked but it looks like a solid blow could pry it open.

fields.name: letter
fields.description: You see a letter written in a strong, bold hand. The writing is in the blocky runes of a language you don't know.

fields.name: destroyed altar
fields.description: A great stone altar sits at the center of the standing stones. It is been smashed in several places and defaced with Cobalt Front slogans painted in blue and red paint. From the carvings that are still visible, you recognize symbols of bounty and good harvests. You guess that the local druids used to perform rituals here before the Cobalt Front destroyed it.

fields.name: vines
fields.description: Blocking the passage to the south is a mass of tangled vines, so thick you can barely see through them.

fields.name: stone altar
fields.description: A stone altar sits here, almost completely covered in vines. On the little that is left exposed, you see carvings of wheat, grape vines, and livestock. There is a strange lump under the mass of vines in the center, and you can sense a powerful magic.

fields.name: hatchet
fields.description: One of the kobolds dropped a rusty hatchet.

fields.name: short sword
fields.description: One of the kobolds dropped a worn short sword.

fields.name: sign
fields.description: Posted here, next to the sign saying "Welcome to Lieto", is another warning against magic users.

fields.name: pamphlet
fields.description: Sitting on a table is a pamphlet showing the glorious deeds of the Cobalt Front

fields.name: side door
fields.description: In the side of the house you see a door that might lead to a cellar.

fields.name: prison keys
fields.description: You see a key ring. Most of the keys are made of the same bluish alloy as the cell doors.

fields.name: spear
fields.description: One of the bandits dropped a long, heavy spear.

fields.name: crossbow
fields.description: One of the bandits dropped a good-quality crossbow.

fields.name: Sword of Righteousness
fields.description: The head inquisitor dropped a finely-wrought, well-balanced long sword. The hilt is carved with intricate patterns including the Cobalt Front logo.

fields.name: double doors
fields.description: You see a set of firmly locked double doors leading to the north, made of some strange bluish metal. They look brand new.

fields.name: double doors
fields.description: You see a set of double doors leading to the south, made of some strange bluish metal.

fields.name: boarded up doorway
fields.description: In the north wall is a doorway that has been boarded shut. It appears that a new wing is being added to the prisons.

fields.name: boarded-up doorway
fields.description: In the south wall is a doorway that has been boarded shut and secured with sturdy nails.

fields.name: flock of sheep
fields.description: You see a flock of sheep. Their coats are lush with the thick, soft wool that is a major export of Virrat.

fields.name: west cell door
fields.description: A cell door, made of bluish, magic-resistant metal, blocks the exit to the west.

fields.name: east cell door
fields.description: A cell door, made of bluish, magic-resistant metal, blocks the exit to the east.

fields.name: beer
fields.description: You see a tankard of locally-brewed ale. It looks refreshing.

fields.name: west cell door
fields.description: A cell door, made of bluish, magic-resistant metal, blocks the exit to the west.

fields.name: east cell door
fields.description: A cell door, made of bluish, magic-resistant metal, blocks the exit to the east.

fields.name: cell door
fields.description: A cell door, made of bluish, magic-resistant metal, blocks the exit to the west.

fields.name: battle axe
fields.description: You see a large, heavy battle axe.

fields.name: pike
fields.description: You see a long-handled pike. It would make a formidable weapon against large foes and soldiers on horseback.

fields.name: lamb sausage
fields.description: You see a spicy sausage made from lamb on a coarse wheat roll, with stone-ground mustard.

fields.name: hard leather armor
fields.description: You see a suit of well-made leather armor. It has been hardened to absorb more damage than most leather armor.

fields.name: huckleberries
fields.description: You see a cloth bag full of ripe huckleberries from the forests north of Virrat.

fields.name: smashed boards
fields.description: The boards that used to block the south wall have warped and twisted. New branches are growing right out of the wood. The rapid growth has bent the boards out of shape, leaving a hole big enough to climb through.

fields.name: smashed boards
fields.description: The boards that used to block the north wall have been twisted and reshaped by the power of the Orb, leaving a hole big enough to climb through.

fields.name: gold sack
fields.description: You see your gold sack.

fields.name: rats on a stick
fields.description: Roasting over a small campfire is a wooden skewer with three dead rats on it.

fields.name: healing potion
fields.description: You see a small, nondescript vial of turquoise liquid on a chain.

fields.name: unconscious Maya
fields.description: You see your friend Maya lying here, close to death. You'd better act quickly if you want to save her!

fields.name: Ainha's body
fields.description: You see the dead body of Maya's grandmother. You have failed in your quest to save her.

fields.name: rotting vegetation
fields.description: You see a pile of foul-smelling vegetation. It is all that remains of the shambling mound.

fields.name: mangled tree trunk
fields.description: The reaper's corpse looks like a hollow tree trunk that has been hacked to pieces by a vengeful woodsman.

fields.name: shredded vines
fields.description: A scattering of shredded vine-line arms is all that's left of the feared assassin vine.

fields.name: Duke's body
fields.description: The dead body of the Duke of Virrat lies here. He was done in by his attempted alliance with the Cobalt Front.

fields.name: inquisitor's body
fields.description: The body of the head inquisitor lies here, still defiant even in death.

fields.name: Velatha's body
fields.description: The corpse of Velatha, the druid leader, lies here. Blood stains her green tunic.

fields.name: wooden chest
fields.description: You find a plain wooden chest sitting just inside the bandits' tent.

fields.name: iron key
fields.description: You see a small iron key.

fields.name: gold coins
fields.description: You see a bag of gold coins. Most of them have the Queen of Evenhold on the obverse; a few appear to be from the nearby kingdom of Nival.

fields.name: gold brooch
fields.description: You see a shiny gold brooch. The rogues must have stolen it from some hapless traveler.

fields.name: safe
fields.description: You see a heavy iron safe enclosed in bands of the bluish alloy. It has a padlock on the front.

fields.name: lightning whip
fields.description: You see a rather curious weapon, a glowing blue whip. It seems to have been enchanted with powerful lightning magic. It crackles as you touch it, and your arm hair stands on end, but it doesn't hurt you as you pick it up.

fields.name: strange potion
fields.description: You see a crystal vial filled with a cloudy orange liquid. Attached to the stopper is a tag reading "May your eye be keen and your steps be quick." You wonder how long it's been here and whether it's still any good.

fields.name: opal pendant
fields.description: You see a beautiful fire opal pendant on a gold chain. The polished stone seems to glow with an inner light all its own. Still, you don't detect any magic within it, and you can't tell why the Cobalt Front would keep it locked up with the magic weapons. It does look valuable, though.

fields.name: magic detector
fields.description: You see a strange metal contraption made of bars and wires. It is one of the detector devices the inquisitors use to locate magic items.

fields.name: mace
fields.description: You see a standard mace.

fields.name: morning star
fields.description: One of the guards dropped a morning star.

fields.name: cat o' nine tails
fields.description: The inquisitor's weapon is a vicious-looking whip with several knotted ends.

fields.name: bound woman
fields.description: The inquisitor's prisoner is middle-aged woman bound to a rough chair. Her clothing is wet with blood and her face has a haunted look. She seems badly injured and can barely speak, though she is still struggling against her bonds.

fields.name: dead soldier
fields.description: You see a human corpse here. Its clothing is in tatters but it looks like it might have been wearing a Cobalt Front tabard. The chest is crushed and the bones are broken in several places. You spot something shiny on its wrist.

fields.name: electrum bracelet
fields.description: On the deceased's wrist, you find a shiny electrum bracelet. It looks undamaged.

fields.name: fire clover
fields.description: A patch of the brilliant orange-red fire clover plant is growing here. Some of the alchemists back in Eamon Towne might pay a pretty penny to acquire it for use in making potions.

fields.text: Maya leans close to you and whispers, "My grandmother's house is outside the east gate of the city. We should go see if we can find her." She looks around warily. "Let's hurry. The people here don't look as friendly as I remember."
Maya says, "My grandmother is in grave danger! I remember that she has a friend who lives in the southwest part of the city. We should find her."
Maya says, "Let's go seek out the safe house."
Maya says, "Grandmother's recent letter mentioned powerful growth magic. Could that have caused this?"
Maya says, "I hope we can find the Wand of Defoliation and the Orb of Aquita."
Maya says, "This Orb scares me. Let's get it back to the safe house."
Maya says, "I'm scared of what will happen to my grandmother! Let's get her out of jail as fast as we can!"
Maya says, "I wonder if any of the mages can read the writing on this letter."
Maya says, "Thank you so much for your help!"
The inquisitor gives you a threatening look. "We will crush the evil magic users with the hammer of righteousness!"
"Be righteous! Report any witches you find to the inquisitors for punishment."

The jailer hears the name you asked about and pounds his fist on the desk. "Ainha, the healer, you say? She is no healer! She is an accused, confessed, and convicted witch! She is safely within a magic-shielded cell in our dungeons, where she will do you no harm. Her execution is scheduled for tomorrow at noon. Come and watch justice be served!"
"If you've come to join the Cobalt Front, you should try the recruiting office across the street. Or, are you just here for a drink?"
You overhear one of the soldiers say, "Once we finish with this nowhere town, we should be strong enough to take the entire kingdom!"
"Since the Cobalt Front got here, I've barely even had a single room open."

"Need a new pike? Or maybe a battle axe?" he says, then whispers, "I see you're from out of town, so I'll tell you, better mind your own business in this town. The Cobalt Front are some of my best customers, and they don't like people snooping around."

"I'm glad the Duke decided to outlaw magic, after the horrors that happened in the old castle. I wish the Cobalt Front would clean up the mess, though. My brother has a farm near there, and one of his dogs was nearly carried off by some terrible swamp monster."

Talia says, "Yes, Ainha is in the prison, all right. I'm trying to lie low, but there is still a safe house in Lieto, the town a few miles west of here. Some folks there might be able to help. It's south of the farmers' market. Say the password OWLFEATHER.

"By the way, in case you're a magic user yourself, be careful. The Cobalt Front have been confiscating magic weapons and arresting anyone they spot casting spells. It won't do us any good if you end up in shackles."
Soldiers rush up and push you away. "No talking to the prisoners!"
"I've been working for weeks making things out of this special alloy the Cobalt Front have. They say it's impervious to all magic, even better than cold iron."
"My sister had to leave town because the Cobalt Front thought she was a witch."

The old man says, "Thank you for rescuing me. I don't know much, but I wager the Cobalt Front is after more than just arresting mages. I'm going to leave town for a while until this blows over.

"If you can find a way to drive the Cobalt Front from Virrat, come meet me at the standing stones outside town. I might be able to find something valuable to give you in reward."

He gathers up his things and walks away.
Maya says, "We should meet the old man at the standing stones before we leave town."

The inquisitor approaches angrily. "You there! I detect a trace of foul witchcraft! Is that a magic weapon?" he yanks your {weapon name} from your hand. "Magic weapons are forbidden here! I will have to confiscate it."

He grabs your weapon and wraps it in a bag of shimmering bluish-silver cloth. "The fine for your transgression is 100 gold pieces. Pay up, or you'll spend the night in the stocks."

The kobolds stand up when they see you and back away nervously. They only take a few steps, however, before they stop, glancing nervously over their shoulders. They seem terrified of whatever is in the castle.
"Stay away from the old castle. There are dangerous magics up there."
"There never used to be bandits or petty thugs in Virrat before the Cobalt Front arrived," the shopkeeper whispers. "The Front seems to allow almost anything, as long as it isn't magic."
"Best leather goods in Virrat! My leather armor is as light as any, but twice as tough."
"The huckleberries are my favorite. Only 1 gold for a pint."

"Things have taken a turn for the worst since Never mind. Several of our friends are in prison in Virrat City. Ainha is one of them. We need to free them before the inquisitors can execute them!

"You might be able to use the Orb of Aquita to rescue the prisoners. It is an object of great power and might be able to penetrate the Cobalt Front's anti-magic shields. If only we had it! But, it was lost in the ruined castle a few miles to the southeast of here.

"You must try to retrieve the Orb. The Wand of Defoliation might help. Zinnah, the former proprietor of the magic shop in Virrat City, is resting in the back room. He might know where to find the Wand."

Velatha hands you a small bag made of silvery cloth. "When you find the Orb, keep it within this bag. It is made of the same material the Front uses to quarantine magic items. They will not be able to detect its magic if it is within the bag.

"Return to us with the Orb and we will help you rescue Ainha."

"I used to run the magic shop in Virrat City before it was destroyed by the Cobalt Front. I did, in fact, have a Wand of Defoliation there. It's a rather dull-looking thing. Looks just like an ordinary stick, in fact. With any luck, the Cobalt Front might not have even noticed it when they wrecked my shop.

"The wand is a weird thing; it makes plants shrivel up and die. Seems not too useful, you'd think. But, ten years ago in Grunewalde, I managed to use one to slay a pesky Venus Flytrap that had me on its lunch menu. Good luck!"
You hack at the vines but they seem to grow back as fast as you cut them.
The wand sends forth a beam of brown light. The vines on the south wall shrivel and die, leaving a passage just big enough to walk through.
The vines around the altar disintegrate. As they fall away, they reveal something shiny sitting on a small pedestal on the altar.
You try to funnel some magic into it, but it doesn't do anything. Maybe if you knew the right spell?
Some nearby plants grow a foot taller, but nothing else happens.
A beam of bright, green light shoots from the orb. It strikes the boards blocking the south wall. They explode into a frenzy of growth as new branches burst forth from the wood.

Velatha smiles. "You found the orb! Thank you so much!"

She listens to your story about the castle. "The monsters were that ferocious, you say? We were running an experiment there, but it was only a life-giving spell, intended to increase the harvest! It should never have produced anything like that! If we ever get a chance, I promise to clean up the jungle and subdue any monsters that remain."

"Now, it's still too dangerous for me to leave the safe house. You must rescue the prisoners. If you can find a weak spot in the prison walls, hold the Orb and say the magic words, 'IRKM DESMET DAEM'. Remember, the Orb's power works with plants, and maybe wood. It will not work on stone or metal. Good luck!"
Ainha smiles upon seeing her granddaughter. "Maya, my dear! I wish I could have gotten word to you, but the soldiers came so quickly. Thank you for coming to find me."
"Thank you for freeing me from this awful place. Quickly, we must leave here before the soldiers find us!"
Nothing but endless prairie in that direction.
The river is too deep to cross without a bridge.
The houses in that direction are all locked.
If you've ever tried to walk through a cornfield, you'll agree with me: stick to the road.
The wall is too high to climb.
The river is too deep!

The old mage says, "I've been inspecting the walls of this cell. I can still sense the power of my magic, but only just barely. I think the metal on the walls is not constructed properly. Maybe with your POWER spell and my magic combined, we can break some of the bars on this window."

You reach out to the ether to draw on some magic. It is a difficult task, but after a few minutes you can harness enough power to find a weak spot in the stonework around the window. With a mighty grunt, you pull loose a couple of the window bars. The resulting hole is just large enough to climb up to the street.

The old mage shakes your hand and says, "Thanks for helping me escape. I'm going to sneak quietly out of this accursed town and get as far away from here as I can. Good luck."

He slips away into the shadows.

No sooner do you utter the words of power than the Cobalt Front soldiers descend on you. "Witchcraft!" they shout. In seconds, they have overwhelmed you. Handcuffs of a bluish metal snap around your wrists, and you feel the magic power slip away. The soldiers strip you of your possessions and haul you off to the prison.
In seconds, the soldiers overwhelm you. They strip you of your possessions and haul you off to the prison.
Several prisoners are in this cell. They thank you for releasing them and hurry out of the room.

The bishop smiles sadly and says, "The Cobalt Front have never interfered with the Church, but attendance is down ever since they arrived. They are converting more and more followers every day. But, their 'services' consist mostly of public floggings in the square. What has happened to the ancient religious traditions of our land?"
"Thank you for freeing us and saving our town from the Cobalt Front."
Try as you might, you can't make sense of the runes on the letter. Maybe someone more educated, like a wizard, might understand it.
The pamphlet is well-designed, but everything you read is nothing more than Cobalt Front propaganda.
The inquisitor blocks your way. "You cannot leave until you pay the fine."
The inquisitor takes your money and stands aside.

The moment the soldiers spot you, they approach. One is holding a strange metal device in his hand, which is humming. The sound grows louder the closer it gets to the Orb. "Did you think you could sneak something that powerful by us?" one says. "If that's the magic from the castle, it will be worth a lot of money when we take it to the inquisitors. Give it to us, or die."
In seconds, the royal guards overwhelm you. They strip you of your possessions and haul you off to the prison.
The soldiers shout, "You're the one who broke into the prison! Die, heretic!"

The soldiers put the orb into a metallic bag and take it solemnly off toward the palace. Well, you blew it. Your only chance to save the magic-users of Virrat is to march down to the headquarters and demand it back.

The soldiers see the Orb on the ground and gather around it, forgetting about you. Someone brings a metallic bag and they place the Orb inside. They then carry it off in the direction of the palace. If you want to save the magic-users of Virrat, you'll have to go down to the Cobalt Front headquarters and get it back.

The inquisitor is holding the Orb of Aquita, looking with revulsion at the light glowing from within it. He and some of his advisors are speaking of a way to destroy it.

Some nearby soldiers spot you and drag you forward. The inquisitor looks at you with smug satisfaction. "So, you're the evil-doer who brought this foul artifact into our town. I knew you were trouble the moment you arrived. Death is too good for you."

He suddenly runs you through with his sword, then strolls away, leaving you to die in the street.
A soldier says, "Don't bother us with that."

Velatha looks at the paper. "These look like Old Nivalan runes. They're the ancient alphabet used centuries ago in the land where the Cobalt Front is from. Olveronin, can you read this?" She hands the letter to an old wizard sitting across the room.

Olveronin studies the letter for a few minutes, his eyes widening as he reads. "This letter is from the Cobalt Front officers to the headquarters of the order in Nival. It says that the Cobalt Front plans to consolidate power here in Virrat, then build up an army large enough to conquer the entire kingdom. The Duke must hear of this!"

A new sense of determination grows among the wizards and druids in the room. They gather their wands and weapons, and put on heavy cloaks. "We must act at once!" Velatha says. "Come with us to the Duke's palace. When he sees this letter, he will have to act to expel the Cobalt Front from Virrat."

The wizards remove their cloaks, and the Duke's eyes widen. "I never knew there were so many mages left in Virrat!" he cries. "Guards!"

The guards approach, but several wizards link hands and the air itself turns as hard as stone, blocking their approach. "Listen to us," Velatha says. "This Cobalt Front is not a beneficial organization, but an evil force bent on conquering the entire kingdom." She thrusts the letter into his hands.

The Duke sees the archaic writing and summons his scribe, who translates the letter for him. His description of the Cobalt Front's plans matches the translation Olveronin gave you.

"I have suspected that the Cobalt Front was up to something for a while," the Duke says. "They are recruiting far too many soldiers just to police a small duchy like Virrat. But I never had any proof, until now. The king will have my head if the Cobalt Front invades the rest of the kingdom! Guards, gather your swords. Send a rider to the king to call in the army!"

The Duke quickly dons an ornate steel breastplate and straps on his sword. "The rest of you, come with me. We must confront the head inquisitor and make him explain himself."

The Duke steps up to the head inquisitor and shows him the letter. The inquisitor feigns ignorance, but he is clearly unnerved by the presence of all the magic users.

"Enough of your lies," the Duke says. "Take all of your fanatics and leave Virrat at once, or die!"

The inquisitor shows more bravado than common sense. He and his men draw their weapons.

The royal guards and several mages fan out and engage some Cobalt Front soldiers in the square, leaving the Duke and you to face the inquisitors.

With the defeat of the inquisitors, the royal guard quickly moves toward the recruiting center, surprising a number of new recruits that never even have time to put on their armor. The mages send runners throughout the city to call to arms anyone who would oppose the Cobalt Front. Within an hour, the remaining Cobalt Front soldiers are facing off against a crowd of townsfolk, mages, and palace guard. Surrounded, they slowly put down their weapons and are escorted from the city.

"Thank you for providing the evidence I needed to drive these fanatics from the city," the Duke says. "But there is still the matter of the castle."

"We will handle that," one of the druids says. "It was our error that caused the infestation of creatures. With your permission, we will take the Orb of Aquita and the Wand of Defoliation and cleanse the countryside of the terrors. We promise that you will never again regret having magic users in your domain."

The mages take the items and head for the western gate of the city.

Meanwhile, the Duke invites you to the palace for a feast that lasts into the night. He gives you a reward of 1,000 gold pieces and tells you that you are welcome in Virrat for as long as you would like to stay.
The next day, you remember something the old man said when you rescued him, about meeting him at the standing stones.
The Duke looks irritated. "Don't waste my time."
"Thank you for saving us from the Cobalt Front!"

The old man you rescued from the thugs is here, busily working at cleaning up the old altar. He greets you warmly, saying, "Thank you for exposing the Cobalt Front for who they really are, and for bringing the Duke to his senses."

He hands you a magic ring. "As a small measure of thanks, take this ring. It will protect you from savage blows. It saved my skin a time or two in my long-ago adventuring days!"

One of the Duke's advisors steps up to you. "Thank you for providing the evidence we needed to drive these fanatics from the city. But there is still the matter of the castle."

"We will handle that," one of the druids says. "It was our error that caused the infestation of creatures. With your permission, we will take the Orb of Acquita and the Wand of Defoliation and cleanse the countryside of the terrors. We promise that you will never again regret having magic users in your domain."

The mages take the items and head for the western gate of the city.

The royal guard captain shakes your hand and tells you that you are welcome in Virrat for as long as you would like to stay.

"Welcome to Virrat!" the Duke says. "Please, don't be alarmed by the soldiers in the city. There was an incident with magic in our land. The Cobalt Front possesses powerful anti-magic materials, and they offered to help keep our citizens safe."

When you ask about Ainha, the Duke shrugs and says, "Any questions about prisoners should be directed to the Cobalt Front. The prison is just east of the main square."
The recruiter says, "If you're looking to join, prove your worth by slaying some of the monsters in the old castle to the west of town."
Beaten up, the thugs run away and disappear into the city!
A mage says, "Talk to Velatha. She can answer your questions."
Bathed in the green glow of the orb, the vines in the castle quiver and pulse, growing ever taller and thicker. Tendrils reach for your arms and legs. You manage to cut yourself free just in time.
You crash through the underbrush for a few minutes, making little progress. Eventually you emerge somewhere near where you started.

Talia opens a drawer and pulls out what looks like a necklace. She hands it to Maya. "It's a dangerous world out there. This has a small flask of healing potion hidden inside. It's probably too small for the Cobalt Front's magic-detecting tools to find. But, to be safe, don't go drinking it in front of them."

Maya takes it and smiles. "Thank you for all your help. We'll find my grandmother."
She is beyond your healing ability. Better take her to a healer, or maybe a wizard.

The mages see Maya's unconscious form and rush to her aid. "This will be a dangerous spell, that the Cobalt Front might detect. Please go stand guard outside."

As you step through the safe house door, you hear the mages and druids begin a low chanting. In a few minutes, the spell is complete. Fortunately, you don't see any sign of Cobalt Front inquisitors in the alley.

Ainha sees that Maya is badly wounded and rushes to her side. "I will take her to a safe place where we can heal her. Meet us in the safe house later." She bundles up Maya's limp form onto a makeshift stretcher and hurries off toward Lieto.
The mages welcome you back into the safe house. "We took Maya to rest in the back room. She will need to stay here for a while to recover. It's all up to you now."
Maya says, "I need to stay here and rest. Please finish what we started."

Velatha sees that Maya is badly wounded and rushes to her side. "I will take her to a safe place where we can heal her. Meet us in the safe house later." She bundles up Maya's limp form onto a makeshift stretcher and hurries off toward Lieto.
Maya, now mostly recovered from her injuries, catches up to you. "I hear there was a big fight!" she says. "I wish I had been there. Do you have my bow? I must have lost it when I was injured."

As you move the detector close to one of your magic items, two of the bars move gradually apart. As you move it away, they swing back together again. You're good enough at spotting magic items that you don't really need such a contraption, but you could probably sell it for a bit of money.
The warden spots you emerging from the prison. He raises his weapon and attacks!
The heavy magic shielding on the prison walls blocks your attempt to cast any spells.
The magic-shielded bag prevents the orb from functioning.

Maya's eyes widen as she sees the effect of the Orb. "That's what it can do to a few boards? Imagine what must it must have been like at the castle with a whole group of mages linked together. That thing is dangerous. Better put it back in the bag before the Cobalt Front sees it!"
The orb radiates a powerful magic aura. It will be a magnet for any Cobalt Front magic-hunters if you don't find a way to shield it.

The inquisitors, with their magic-detecting devices, spot the Orb immediately. With shouts of "Witchcraft!" they send a squadron of soldiers after you. You try to run but you can't escape them all. In minutes, you are captured and stripped of all your possessions.

The head inquisitor snarls and runs you through with his sword. "I knew you were trouble the moment you arrived in town," he says, as he wipes the blood from his blade on your tunic. Then he turns and walks away, leaving you lying in the street.

Your last thought is that you have just ruined the only chance to rescue the innocent people being held in the prison.

You tell the old mage that you don't actually know the Power spell.

"I see. Well, then it's time you learned," he says. He spends several minutes teaching you the incantation, making you practice until you have the intonation just right.

"That should be good enough," he says. "Now, give it a try."

Maya sees you walk up and runs over. "I didn't think I would see you again," she says. "How did you get out of the prison?"

You tell her the story and she listens carefully.

"So they took all your stuff? We'll need to find replacements. I have a little gold saved up that should be enough to buy a weapon from the armorer. I also heard someone mention that there's a good leatherworker in Lieto who sells armor."

She hands you what gold she can spare.

fields.name: Maya
fields.description: Your friend Maya stands by your side. She is a young half-elf with brown skin and long, black hair. She is tall and lean, wearing chain mail and a cloak in the colors of a free adventurer. Her long bow is well made, but she holds it in an unfamiliar grip, as if she is just learning how to use it.

fields.name: Talia
fields.description: You see a gray-haired woman sitting by the hearth, reading a book. She looks up as you enter and introduces herself as Talia, a friend of Maya's family.

fields.name: soldier
fields.description: You see a group of soldiers wearing the blue tabards of the Cobalt Front. They carry long-handled pikes.

fields.name: Duke
fields.description: The Duke of Virrat is sitting here in his throne. He is a middle-aged gentleman in fine clothing, with a worried look on his face.

fields.name: royal guard
fields.description: You see several soldiers of the Royal Guard, wearing plate armor and helmets. Their breastplates are painted with the traditional purple color of the Duchy.

fields.name: Head Inquisitor
fields.description: You see a short man with an intense look on his face. He is wearing crimson robes of very fine quality, with chain mail underneath, and carries a fine sword with the Cobalt Front logo carved into the hilt. He glares at you.

fields.name: inquisitor
fields.description: You see a group of Cobalt Front inquisitors, wearing red robes with chain mail underneath.

fields.name: prison warden
fields.description: The head warden of the prison is sitting behind a desk. He arrogantly smooths his Cobalt Front tabard as you enter, and gives you an impatient look.

fields.name: bartender
fields.description: The bartender is a tough-looking middle-aged woman dressed in plain clothing. She looks up from polishing a tankard and says, "New recruits, or just passing through?"

fields.name: soldier
fields.description: You see a group of off-duty soldiers. They seem to be a mix of both stern-faced Cobalt Front types and the more genial Virrat city guardsmen.

fields.name: innkeeper
fields.description: The innkeeper, an elderly man with a wisp of hair on his head, sits behind the desk. He looks tired but has a kindly smile.

fields.name: shopkeeper
fields.description: The proprietor of the shop is a stocky younger man with a well-trimmed beard. He is busily restocking the shelves and weapons racks.

fields.name: food vendor
fields.description: You see a woman in plain farm clothing standing next to a cart on one side of the bridge. She is selling lamb sausages, a local specialty.

fields.name: old man
fields.description: You see an elderly man with a scared look on his face. He has his hands up and is backing slowly away from two young men.

fields.name: thug
fields.description: A pair of thugs, dressed in ordinary street clothes, are accosting the old man, shouting things like "Get out of town, evildoer!" and "Death to magic users!"

fields.name: shepherd
fields.description: You see a teenage boy in simple clothing, tending a flock of sheep along the side of the road.

fields.name: recruiter
fields.description: A well-dressed man in a spotless Cobalt Front uniform is sitting behind a desk. "Come to purge the land of evil magic?" he asks.

fields.name: kobold
fields.description: Two scrawny, filthy kobolds look up from a small campfire they have made right in the middle of the entrance. From the rubbish around, it appears they have been living here for weeks.

fields.name: shambling mound
fields.description: You see a huge mound of live and rotting vegetation. It gives off an awful reek and seems to be standing up under its own power. Suddenly, it moves, reaching toward you with vinelike tendrils!

fields.name: reaper
fields.description: A ten-foot-tall dead tree stands here, with branches that look like arms. As you approach, it turns toward you, showing red eyes and a dark slit in the bark for a mouth. You feel the tingle of electricity in the air.

fields.name: assassin vine
fields.description: A large vine-like creature stands in the center of the room, upon a pile of jumbled roots. It has a gaping mouth at the end of the largest vine. It snaps at you with its fearsome jaws and reaches for you with its tendrils!

fields.name: bandit
fields.description: You see a group of bandits camped along the shore of the river. When they see you approach, one mutters something about "foreigners" and they attack!

fields.name: soldier
fields.description: You see some soldiers in Cobalt Front uniforms standing guard at the entrance to town. They eye you suspiciously.

fields.name: shopkeeper
fields.description: A middle-aged woman is tending the store. She looks you over as you enter, then relaxes. It's almost as if she's relieved you're not soldiers.

fields.name: soldier
fields.description: Some off-duty soldiers are lounging in the garrison, playing cards.

fields.name: soldier
fields.description: Some soldiers are here, standing watch over the entrance to town. They ignore you.

fields.name: leatherworker
fields.description: You see a leatherworker manning one of the stalls. He waves you over to see his wares.

fields.name: food vendor
fields.description: A teenage girl is standing behind a table filled with boxes of onions, tomatoes, and wild huckleberries.

fields.name: stable boy
fields.description: You see a teenage boy currying one of the horses.

fields.name: Velatha
fields.description: A middle-aged Elven woman in the green cloak of a Druid appears to be the leader of the group. She has a weary look on her face, as if she hasn't slept in days. She introduces herself as Velatha, the leader of the Druids.

fields.name: mage
fields.description: A group of six women and three men are seated quietly on the stone floor. They look at you with wary eyes.

fields.name: Zinnah
fields.description: You see an old man resting on a makeshift cot. His tunic is blood-stained and his arm is wrapped in a sling. He looks up as you enter. "Yes?"

fields.name: Ainha
fields.description: You see an elderly woman in tattered prison garb. Despite the fifty years' age difference, and the lack of pointed ears, she looks a lot like Maya.

fields.name: old wizard
fields.description: You see a prisoner in filthy, torn-up wizard's robes. He explains that he was just passing through town when the Cobalt Front arrested him.

fields.name: blacksmith
fields.description: You see a large man working the forge. He seems friendly but exhausted.

fields.name: bishop
fields.description: Sitting here, reading a holy book, is the Bishop of Virrat. She is wearing the traditional clerical vestments of the Evenhold Reformed Church.

fields.name: freed prisoners
fields.description: The prisoners thank you for releasing them from the stocks.

fields.name: giant crocodile
fields.description: Basking at the water's edge is the largest crocodile you have ever seen. The magic that formed the jungle must have made it grow quickly as well. It stirs from its slumber and rushes toward you.

fields.name: prison guard
fields.description: Two guards stand here, keeping a keen eye on the prisoners in the cells. You notice that their chain mail has a bluish tint, as if it's made of the Cobalt Front's special magic-proof alloy.

fields.name: inquisitor
fields.description: A Cobalt Front inquisitor stands here, torturing a prisoner. "You will confess!" he shouts fanatically. "Or you and your family will die!"

fields.name: freed prisoner
fields.description: The woman slips free of her bonds and thanks you for rescuing her. She then runs out the door as fast as her wobbly legs can carry her.

fields.question: Help! I got thrown in jail!
How do I find some help?
How do I get the orb?
How can I read the foreign runes?

fields.answer: Talk to the old man to find a way out.
Magic is illegal here, and that includes magic weapons. If you walk around with a magic weapon readied, the inquisitors will confiscate it and fine you.
If you get stopped by an inquisitor, you'll need to PAY FINE before you can leave.
You'll need to talk to someone in Virrat City, then someone in the town of Lieto.
Go to the southwest corner of Virrat City and look for the only house you can go into. Talk to its occupant.

From the plaza: go south to the 4-way intersection, then west twice, and south once. TALK TO TALIA. She gives you the password to the safe house. Go back to the plaza and travel far to the west (and a little north) until you reach Lieto. Go south from the farmer's market to find a door in an alley. Open it and give the password when you're asked.

The TALK command is important in this adventure. Try talking to everyone you meet. Some people will give general information about the town and recent events, and others will give valuable clues. e.g., TALK TO MAYA.
The BUY command lets you buy various items. What's for sale in any given location is shown after the description of the people and things. e.g., BUY BEER.
The PAY command is used for paying fines, should you find yourself breaking the law. e.g., PAY FINE.
You need a special item. The people in the safe house can tell you where to find it.
Talk to Zinnah in the back room of the safe house. He tells you about a Wand of Defoliation in his old magic shop. Go to Virrat City and look for the shop near the south gate.
Once you have the Wand, you can use it to destroy some of the vegetation in the castle. When your way is blocked by vines, USE WAND to break through.
When you reach the castle tower, USE WAND again to find the Orb.
The Wand is also useful against any plant-based monsters you fight. You can't ready it; just USE WAND when the monster is around.
Go east from the grand plaza. Look for the house outside of town. The prison warden also has some clues.

Once you get the Orb of Aquita, you'll need to find a weak point in the prison walls. Most of the prison is too well shielded with magic-proof alloy to get in. Since the Orb is a growth enhancer, something made of wood might be the key.
Go to the east gate and north through the alley to the construction site. Remove the Orb from the bag and say the magic words (IRKM DESMET DAEM).
Take the letter to the safe house and GIVE LETTER TO VELATHA. All will become clear.

The real Malleus Maleficarum (roughly, the "Hammer of Witches") is a book published in 1486 about the supposed horrors of demons and witchcraft. It caused quite a number of tragic witch hunts throughout the Renaissance.
Any Bard's Tale or Ultima fans, see if you can spot a few familiar references.

The magic words "IRKM DESMET DAEM" were written on a dungeon wall in Bard's Tale 1. They didn't mean anything in that game, but they do here.

The Reaper (animate dead tree that casts lightning and other spells) is a notable foe in several of the Ultima games. The Lightning Whip is also featured in Ultima 7.

The Wand of Defoliation was an essential item in the 1991 D&D CRPG Gateway to the Savage Frontier, a game which featured the shambling mound as a frequent enemy.

There is a unique item in this adventure. You can only get it after completing the quest, but you need to do something near the beginning to get it. Once you have it, you can take it back to the Main Hall and keep it as part of your permanent equipment.

Unlike Classic Eamon on the Apple II and Eamon Deluxe for PC, Eamon Remastered allows you to have multiple types of armor besides just the standard leather/chain/plate and a shield.

Find the old man being attacked by thugs in the southeast of Virrat City. Chase off the thugs. The old man will thank you and leave. When you finally defeat the Cobalt Front, meet the old man at the standing stones to get a Ring of Protection.
The Cobalt Front have a special place where they take magic weapons for safe-keeping. You can get your weapon back if you look there.
All confiscated weapons are stored in the storage room in the prison.
